com.caseybrooks.androidbibletools.basic

Class AbstractVerse

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.caseybrooks.androidbibletools.basic.AbstractVerse
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<AbstractVerse>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Passage, Verse

    public abstract class AbstractVerse
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<AbstractVerse>
    An abstract implementation of a Verse in the Bible. A verse represents a location and its text, and is considered immutable in that the location the verse points to is fixed. A verse contains several peripheral classes to give a verse metadata, provide intelligent sorting, and create a consistent IO pattern.

      • getText

        public abstract java.lang.String getText()
        Get a human-readable text representation of this verse using the set Formatter. Default formatters can display the text in various ways designed for memorization, but custom Formatters can be configured for any kind of output, including HTML, XML, or JSON
        Returns:
        String
        See Also:
        setFormatter(com.caseybrooks.androidbibletools.data.Formatter)

      • getVerseInfo

        public abstract void getVerseInfo(org.jsoup.nodes.Document doc)
        Load data from the Bibles.org API response into this Verse. Uses either the response just downloaded, or a previously cached and parsed file.
        Parameters:
        doc - a Jsoup Document containing the XML response to be parsed
